Package anydev

Class Column

java.lang.Object
anydev.Column
public class Column extends Object
Define a data column (either for input or output data) Represents the metadata definition of a single column in a dataset, including its name, its canonical ColumnType, and optional information about its original source data type. This class does NOT store actual data values for the column.
Since:
v1.0.0

    Column.ColumnBuilderTypeStep
     
    static enum 
    Column.Type
    Defines a canonical set of data types that represent common data types found in databases, CSV files, and Excel spreadsheets, mapping them to standard Java data types.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns:
      The column name.

    • getType

      public Column.Type getType()
      Gets the explicit canonical (data-)Type of this column.
      Returns:
      The type of data stored in this column

    • getType

      public static Column.Type getType(Object value)
      Attempts to infer a Column.Type from a given Java object. This is useful when reading data and trying to guess its type.
      Parameters:
      value - The object to infer the type from.
      Returns:
      The inferred Column.Type, or UNKNOWN if no direct mapping is found.

    • getOriginalSourceType

      public Optional<String> getOriginalSourceType()
      Gets the original source-specific data type string if available.
      Returns:
      The original source type string, or empty if not provided.

    • create

      public static Column.ColumnBuilderNameStep create(String name)
      Start creating a new Column
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the column. Must be lower-case and no spaces, must not be empty or null
      Throws:
      SanityCheckException - if name is not lower-case or has spaces

    • canAdd

      public boolean canAdd(Object obj)
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to be checked
      Returns:
      true if given object could be added to this column, false if it does not "fit" (due to column data type)

    • equals

      Overrides the default equals method to provide a deep comparison of Column objects.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      true if the specified object is equal to this Column; false otherwise.
